author: news@plymouthherald.co.uk (Maxine Denton)
title: Jobs in Plymouth you can apply for right now to kick start 2024
text: If you're looking for a career change this new year, now is the perfect time to get looking as there are plenty of roles available in Plymouth right now. Whether you want to make the next step or bolster your income with some additional part-time hours, there are jobs to suit all. From working as a nuclear health physics monitor apprentice for Plymouth's international defence and engineering giant to handling calls from members of the public at the city's 111 contact centre, there are a range of positions going. The roles also require different levels of experience and training will be provided on the job for some, so it's worth looking into if you're not too sure whether you'd be the right candidate. We've taken a look at the roles you can apply for right now to kick-start the new year. Scroll down to take a look and let us know what you make of some of these jobs in the comment section below. Read more: [Village pub transformed into award-winning foodie destination](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/news/plymouth-news/village-pub-transformed-award-winning-8962605) [Destination gastropub The Plough among the best in the UK for foodies](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/news/plymouth-news/hidden-gem-gastropub-plough-among-8946455) Nuclear Health Physics Monitor Apprenticeship- Babcock International Location: [Devonport](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/all-about/devonport) Description: A nuclear health physics monitor offers radiological monitoring services in the nuclear industry. Their role is to protect people, plant and the environment against the harmful effects of ionising radiation and contamination. Some of the tasks in this role include: taking readings of surface, air and personal contamination, detecting radiation dose rates using various detectors, and performing calculations to assess exposure risks. Pay: £26,519 a year Business Administration Apprentice- Plymouth City Council Location: Plymouth Description: The main purpose of this role is to deliver an excellent, customer-focused administrative support to other services and stakeholders across [Plymouth City Council](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/all-about/plymouth-city-council), as well as external customers. The apprenticeship will build your knowledge and skills in a range of areas including verbal and written communication, IT competencies including Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook, working with others and understanding of organisational policies and practices. SEN Classroom Assistant- The Supply Room Location: Plymouth Description: As a SEND teaching assistant, your responsibilities will include: supporting students with diverse SEND, including but not limited to Autism, ADHD, and Dyslexia, assisting in implementing individualised [education](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/all-about/education) plans, encouraging student engagement and participation in classroom activities, and collaborating with the educational team to provide effective support. Pay: £82.00 - £86.75 a day Outdoor Learning Wild Tribe Development Coach - Arena Sport Partnership Location: Plymouth & East Cornwall Description: This role is a part-time, fixed term contract until the end of August 2024 but is likely to be extended until the end of August 2025. They are looking for an enthusiastic, passionate and dedicated outdoor learning development coach to join their team. The ideal candidate will need to have a minimum of a level 3 forest schools qualification or an equivalent outdoor learning qualification. Pay: £20,597 - £32,133 a year Support Worker- British Red Cross Location: [Derriford Hospital](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/all-about/derriford-hospital) Description: A day in the life of a service support worker will involve: providing practical and emotional support and guidance to service users, responding to referrals from clinicians and community health professionals, supporting service users up to 72 hours after hospital discharge or to prevent readmission, and taking someone to a hospital appointment that they otherwise couldn’t get to or be picking up prescriptions and shopping. Pay: £10.90 an hour Pupil Services Lead - St Christopher's Multi Academy Trust Locations: Plymouth, [Tavistock](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/all-about/tavistock) and West Devon Description: This role will be based in Old Priory Junior School in [Plympton](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/all-about/plympton) and will support other schools within the roles in their localities, though you will work collaboratively with colleagues across all Trust schools. The ideal candidate will have experience of working within a school administration role and have a working knowledge of management information and school communication systems and pupil attendance processes. Pay: £17,984 - £20,877 a year [NHS](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/all-about/nhs) 111 Health Advisor- Practice Plus Group Location: Plymouth Description: As a Health Advisor in Plymouth's 111 contact centre, you will handle calls from members of the public. You’ll learn how to use a state-of-the-art triage tool called NHS Pathways to assess patients over the phone and direct them to the most appropriate care. Although these are not emergency calls, you’ll also need to be prepared to deal with emotional, distressing or life-threatening scenarios and to arrange for 999 services if required. Pay: £11.48 - £14.77 an hour

author: J. M. Carbajal
title: Así se está desarrollando el Mercado Artesano y Ecológico en Cangas de Onís
text: Así se está desarrollando el Mercado Artesano y Ecológico en Cangas de Onís El encuentro estará operativo hasta el domingo Desde primeras horas de la mañana de hoy, viernes, el goteo de turistas y visitantes es constante en la céntrica plaza Camila Beceña, colindante con la Casa Consistorial, en la ciudad de Cangas de Onís, con motivo del Mercado Artesano y Ecológico, donde se localizan buen número de stands que ofrecen a la potencial clientela piezas únicas hechas a mano por artesanos asturianos (joyería, cerámica, textiles, pintura...). Además, los amantes de la buena gastronomía podrán deleitarse con una selección de productos ecológicos y tradicionales, desde quesos hasta vino, productos de obrador o huerta. La cita veraniega también permanecerá abierta a lo largo de la jornada de mañana, sábado, convirtiéndose en un atractivo más en estas fechas en la vieja capital del Reino de Asturias. author: 央视新闻客户端
title: 年均交付27艘，中国造船业纪录持续刷新_京报网
text:
记者从中船集团获悉，8月8日，由中国船舶集团有限公司旗下上海外高桥造船有限公司建造的9000车位汽车运输船“GRANDE TIANJIN”号命名交付。
此次交付的“GRANDE TIANJIN”号具备9000车标准装载能力，可兼容电动车、传统燃料汽车及重型滚装货物。该船采用新型低油耗主机、节能装置，显著降低能耗，实现靠泊零碳排放，并获得意大利船级社“氨燃料预留”认证，为未来零碳燃料改装预留技术空间。“GRANDE TIANJIN”号的船坞及码头建造周期仅179天，刷新同型船建造纪录。据悉，“GRANDE TIANJIN”号拟定于8月19日开启首航，主要搭载中国新能源汽车并运营中欧间航线。
至此，外高桥造船自2003年交付首制15万吨级海上浮式生产储油装置（FPSO）“海洋石油111”以来，累计完工交付600艘（座）船舶及海工平台共计1亿202万载重吨，以年均27艘/463.7万载重吨的交付效率持续刷新中国造船业纪录，建造能力覆盖大型邮轮、中大型油船、中大型集装箱船、汽车运输船、海上钻采及海上生产储卸油装置等高技术高附加值船型的完整产品谱系，成为全球唯一可同时建造民用船舶、海工装备和大型邮轮的企业。
更多热点速报、权威资讯、深度分析尽在北京日报App
